bill_title: to allow the use of absentee voting in certain township elections and to allow registered voters to file a petition requiring township candidates to file a nominating petition.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to allow the use of absentee voting in certain township elections. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 8-3 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any voter qualified to vote in a township election may vote by absentee ballot in the township election for the offices of township supervisor, township clerk, township treasurer, and township constable, if a constable is to be elected. The absentee vote may be cast on a printed ballot prepared by the township or on a printed or written ballot prepared by the voter. The absentee ballot shall bear the voter's signature and date of signing, shall specify the name and address of the voter, and, for each office or position, shall specify the name of the person receiving the vote for the corresponding office or position. To be eligible to receive a vote by virtue of an absentee ballot, the candidate for office shall have filed with the clerk a nominating petition in compliance with § 8-3-1.2. To be eligible for consideration in the election, each absentee ballot shall be notarized and shall be received in the office of the township clerk by 5 p.m. on the Monday immediately preceding the election.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to allow the use of absentee voting in certain township elections. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 8-3-1.1 be amended to read as follows: 8-3-1.1. The board of supervisors of a township may, by ordinance, require a candidate for township office to file a nominating petition pursuant to § 8-3-1.2. If, however, a petition is filed by twelve freeholders of the township by January first requesting that nomination petitions be filed by all candidates for township office, then the board of supervisors shall, by ordinance, require nominating petitions to be filed pursuant to § 8-3-1.2. Section 2. That chapter 8-3 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If nominating petitions are required pursuant to § 8-3-1.1, then any voter qualified to vote in a township election may vote by absentee ballot as prescribed in chapter 12-19. BILL HISTORY 1/21/98 First read in House and referred to Local Government. H.J. 146 1/29/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/29/98 Local Government Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 7, NAYS 4. H.J. 310

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to allow the use of absentee voting in certain township elections and to allow registered voters to file a petition requiring township candidates to file a nominating petition. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 8-3-1.1 be amended to read as follows: 8-3-1.1. The board of supervisors of a township may, by ordinance, require a candidate for township office to file a nominating petition pursuant to § 8-3-1.2. If a township has fifty or more registered voters, ten percent or more of the registered voters may file a petition, by October first, requesting that nomination petitions be filed by all candidates for township office. If such petition is filed, the board of supervisors shall adopt a resolution requiring each candidate for township office to file a nominating petition pursuant to § 8-3-1.2. Section 2. That chapter 8-3 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If nominating petitions are required pursuant to § 8-3-1.1, then any voter qualified to vote in a township election may vote by absentee ballot as prescribed in chapter 12-19. BILL HISTORY 1/21/98 First read in House and referred to Local Government. H.J. 146 1/29/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/29/98 Local Government Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 7, NAYS 4. H.J. 310 1/30/98 Local Government Hog Housed. 2/2/98 House of Representatives Deferred to another day. H.J. 352 2/3/98 Motion to Amend, Passed. H.J. 365 2/3/98 House of Representatives Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 44, NAYS 21. H.J. 366 2/3/98 House of Representatives Title Amended. H.J. 366
